subject: RE: [junit] How can I get Junit Test to run in parallel threads?
msgSnippet: ... Mike: Not to beat a dead horse but since your append questions my intentions in a public forum, I do feel I should respond (just one more time) there as
messageBody:
Mike Clark wrote:

> Michael Silverstein wrote:
>
> >I'm surprised to hear this now Mike, since you and I exchanged a
> few notes
> >when the product was released in July. Looking back at the emails we
> >exchanged, your only real comment about it then was, "I would be
> interested
> >to hear anything you hear from your EJU customers about
> JUnitPerf." I also
> >made the comment to you that "I hope it wasn't too presumptuous of us to
> >include it", which you never responded to.
> >
> >
>
> What surprises you about my response?
>
> No doubt, I was disappointed that you didn't contact me prior to
> distributing JUnitPerf. It's not that I wouldn't have allowed you to do
> so, just that I expected something a little more collegial. The
> after-action report stating that it was being distributed and that you
> hoped that was cool didn't sit well with me. It didn't come across as
> genuine, but perhaps it was just my interpretation. Going back to the
> reason for my response, it didn't have that community feel.
>
> I don't want this thread to become a reflection of your product. If
> there's follow-up, let's take it offline.

Mike:

Not to beat a dead horse but since your append questions my intentions in a
public forum, I do feel I should respond (just one more time) there as well.
I agree that anything further should go offline.

To be absolutely specific, the integration with JUnitPerf in Enhanced JUnit
consists of a chapter in the manual on how to do additional stuff with
JUnitPerf. This was based on some last minute ideas we had and chose to
document shortly before release. We then had the choice of either providing
a link to JUnitPerf or providing the distribution itself. It seemed like it
would be more convenient for our customers to actually provide the JUnitPerf
distribution itself, and it was fairly small so we chose to do that.

This decision was made at the last minute when we were putting together our
own distribution. Had the thought occurred to us earlier we might have
contacted you first, but it didn't and we didn't and for that I apologize.
Had I had any inkling that it would have caused you or anyone else the
slightest mental distress, I would have done everything in my power to
prevent that. Again, I didn't get any indication that you were at all
disappointed in our correspondence last July but it might have been there
and I just didn't pick up on it.

In the next release, we will take out the JUnitPerf distribution and just
provide a link to your web site. That will also settle the question of
whether our customers have access to the very latest JUnitPerf code, which
solves a problem for me.

- Mike
